page.title: 14Modern implement - Pen
page.content: A typical pen is a cylinder 16cm long with a 1cm diameter. One end tapers to a little ball which rolls along the paper as you write. Inside the pen is a tube which contains ink. As you hold the pen for writing, the ink flows down to the bottom of the pen, onto the ball, which rolls the ink onto the paper. This sort of pen is called a {ball point pen. }It is less messy than a fountain pen, and you do not have to blot your writing to dry the ink. Some people still use the fountain pen as the writing is neater with it, but most people use a ball point as it is quicker and less fussy. I would not have liked to have used a quill, which was a feather which had to be dipped in ink each few words. Pens come in many colours, usually of metal or plastic, and often with an advetisement for a company on.
